plugins.name: cloud-metadata
plugins.description: This plugin allows you to determine an instance's physical processor and thermal design power based on its instance name.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: coefficient
plugins.description: Coefficient is a generic plugin for multiplying a value in an input array by a given coefficient. You provide the name of the value you want to multiply, a coefficient value, and a name to use to append the product to the output array. For example, you could multiply cpu/energy by 10 and name the result energy-product. energy-product would then be added to every observation in your input array as the product of cpu/energy and 10.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: divide
plugins.description: divide is a generic plugin for doing arithmetic division of two values in an input array. You provide the names of the values you want to divide, and a name to use to add the divide to the output array. For example, boavizta-cpu need cpu/number-cores to work, however cloud-metadata returns vcpus-allocated, to get number of cores you divide vcpus-allocated by 2.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: mock-observations
plugins.description: A plugin for mocking observations (inputs) for Impact Framework plugin development.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: multiply
plugins.description: multiply is a generic plugin for multiplying two values in an input array together. You provide the names of the values you want to multiply, and a name to use to add the product to the output array. For example, multiply cpu/energy and number-cores to get total-energy.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: regex
plugins.description: regex is a generic plugin to match part of one value using regular expressions and appending the result to another value. For example, you could match the cpu/energy using /number-cores/ and return the cpu/energy-per-core.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: boavizta
plugins.description: Boavizta is an environmental impact calculator plugin for Impact Framework. It estimates the environmental impact of cloud hardware using the Boavizta API.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: ccf
plugins.description: Cloud Carbon Footprint is an open source tool for measuring and optimizing your cloud computing carbon emissions. This plugin integrates CCF with the Impact Framework.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: co2js
plugins.description: CO2js estimates the carbon cost of websites, here wrapped as a IF plugin
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: teads-curve
plugins.description: Teads Engineering team has built a plugin that is capable of estimating CPU usages across varying type of CPUs using a curve commonly known as Teads Curve.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: watt-time
plugins.description: WattTime technology—based on real-time grid data, cutting-edge algorithms, and machine learning—provides first-of-its-kind insight into your local electricity grid’s marginal emissions rate. Here Watt-ime is wrapped as an Impact Framework plugin.
plugins.author: Green Software Foundation

plugins.name: carbon-intensity-plugin
plugins.description: The Carbon Intensity plugin grabs grid intensity data from the UK National Grid carbon intensity API for a given date.
plugins.author: Joseph Cook
